hypothesis: OpenAI-ES uses diagonal covariance approximation, reducing overhead compared to CMA-ES's full covariance. May converge faster for low-dim problems.

tuning_runs.notes: Much worse - too many simulations (~400+ per sample)
Better but still worse than baseline
Worse than baseline (-0.0158 score, +4.3 min). 2-src RMSE 0.2349 still problematic.

key_finding: OpenAI ES cannot beat CMA-ES for this low-dimensional problem. CMA-ES's full covariance matrix adaptation is crucial for accurate convergence in 2-4D parameter space. OpenAI ES's diagonal approximation loses important correlation information.
